intro: Sessea graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered sessea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Sessea graciliflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
